intro: Lampranthus albus, commonly known as the white fireplant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often striking floral displays. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, adapting it to arid environments. Its flowers, which are typically white or pale pink, bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils with minimal water.
